title: memphis ten trick
name: memphis ten trick
description:
A Map by Grobilio

this map is a list of the best places my friends and I partied at in the rowdiest town in the dirty south, the M town.  Whether it was the owner of FedEx, Fred Smith's houses, Beale Street, an MTV party, or even a rapper's house, we did it all in memphis ten.

properties.name: Bars on Beale
properties.description: Posted by Grobilio

properties.name: Guto's Home, and the FedEx St. Jude's Golf Tournament
properties.description: Posted by Grobilio My friend Guto has lived in southwind since the 4th grade and for about 6 or 7 years this was my favorite place to be. His dad owns Buckman Labs and has traveled to over 100 different countries. They always had great food, my favorite was always the grilled chicken hearts. This is place where I had my first beer, first kiss, and pretty much everything else. The best time to be there though was during the FedEx St Jude\'s Golf Tournament when we would sneak onto the course at night and maybe take a keg shell or just mess around. The picture is at the Golf Tournament in 11th grade and we got a lot of weird looks for our innapropriate dress at the tournament.

properties.name: Music in May (either MusicFest or BBQ fest)
properties.description: Posted by Grobilio Memphis in May is a staple highlight of each one of my years in memphis. Whether it was having some drinks with the memphis grizzlies in their tent (Mike Miller), eating all the free BBQ in the city with the world\'s best, or standing front row at a Three Six Mafia concert or even a Robert Randolph show.

properties.name: The Smith compound
properties.description: Posted by Grobiliomy friend Cannon Smith, son of FedEx founder and CEO Fred Smith, threw some insane parties in this compound. We would party in the pool house, guest house, or the middle of his land till early morning and his cook, who was on call all the time, would fix us the best breakfast ever at around 5 in the morning. My high school eventually found out and told him that if he has one more and they find out he did then he would be expelled. So, we had to move our parties to his farm, that had about 5 houses on the land and 10 fourwheelers that we drove party to party.

properties.name: The Wingfield residence
properties.description: Posted by GrobilioThis house made my junior and senior year. We always had our pregame or even just the party here and it was always fun. This house did not get busted once and I got some of the craziest stories from just inside this house. O yea his mom founded the Collierville animal shelter so the house was always filled with about 12 animals. The one in the photo is Little Sister and she is the queen of the homestead.

properties.name: my friend sean's house on Mud Island
properties.description: Posted by Grobiliothe ice louche (im not sure thats how u spell it though)

properties.name: south park bar and grill
properties.description: Posted by Grobilio this was our bar, we found this place and soon it became a once a week thing for about 50 of my friends. It was our sophmore and junior year when this was our oasis. Its in the ghetto so the cops had real crimes to deal with, not underage consumption. It didn\'t matter though because the owners of the bar would charge a 5 dollar cover charge at the door and they would give that to the cops so there wouldn\'t be any trouble. Its now a little out of hand but the spirit lives on...

properties.name: the MTV sweet 16 party
properties.description: Posted by Grobilio This was one of the most fun times I have ever had. It was beginning of summer going into junior year, or maybe senior year, im not sure, and these 2 girls we knew were asked by mtv to have their party on my super sweet 16 on MTV. I hate MTV and that show but it was incredible. D4L was number one on the charts with Shake that laffy taffy and Triple 6 Mafia was there with Poppin My Collar and they were throwing 100 dollar bills into the crowd. The building was packed and I dont understand why but I can not find the pictures that I took while we were there but I do have a good after party shot of my friend.

properties.name: the Peabody Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Grobilio this is where we did all our tuxedo partying, but we always ended up stumbling down to beale to eat at around 3 in the morning. We always ran into somebody famous down there too: Isaac Hayes, Shane Battier, etc.

properties.name: the memphis zoo
properties.description: Posted by Grobilioi know this place kind of breaks the trend that I\'ve set with my other places but this was always a big part of my life in memphis. The zoo was the place to walk off ur hangover or the place to pay 5 dollars and just have a great time. Overton park is right next door, we would go play football, play ultimate frisbee, go golfing, or just have a picnic in the grass. It has gone way down hill since those days but I will always love it. And its only place in the entire nation that Interstate 40 stops. They were going to build straight through it but a month before some hippie discovered that an indangered species of duck lands here once a year and it needs to stay protected. I always thought that was pretty cool.
